    • Constructor Detail

      • AttributeTable

        public AttributeTable(java.lang.String fileName)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Used to create an AttributeTable object when the DBF file already exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String containing the full file name and directory.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • AttributeTable

        public AttributeTable(java.lang.String fileName,
                      DBFField[] fields,
                      boolean destroy)
               throws DBFException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Used to create an AttributeTable object when the DBF file does not already exist. A new DBF file will be created and initialized with the specified fields but it will not contain any records.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String containing the full file name and directory.
        fields - Array of DBFField type.
        destroy - Option to destroy an existing DBF file.
        Throws:
        DBFException
        java.io.IOException

      • addField

        public void addField(DBFField field)
              throws DBFException
        Appends a new field at the end of the attribute table. Notice that the dbf file must already exist.
        Parameters:
        field - the DBFField to append.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • addField

        public void addField(DBFField field,
                     int insertAt)
              throws DBFException
        Adds a DBFField after the specified index. Index 0 specifies before the first field and index fieldCount specifies after the last field.
        Parameters:
        field. - An initialized DBFField object.
        insertAt. - The index to insert field.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • deleteField

        public void deleteField(int removeIndex)
                 throws DBFException
        Removes the specified index from the fields. Warning: this method creates a new file with less fields and will delete the old one.
        Parameters:
        removeIndex - The index to remove from the fieldArray
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • deleteField

        public void deleteField(java.lang.String fieldName)
                 throws DBFException
        Deletes the field with the name fieldName. If multiple fields exist with the name, the first in index order will be removed.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - String matching the field to be removed
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • getRecord

        public java.lang.Object[] getRecord(int n)
                             throws DBFException
        Reads the returns the nth row in the DBF stream.
        Parameters:
        n - Record number.
        Returns:
        The nth record as an Object array. Types of the elements these arrays follow the convention mentioned in the class description.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • getRecords

        public java.lang.Object[] getRecords(int startingRecord,
                                     int endingRecord)
                              throws DBFException
        Reads the records from startingRecord to endingRecord from the table.
        Parameters:
        startingRecord - the first record read (zero-based).
        endingRecord - the last record read (note the range is inclusive of endingRecord).
        Returns:
        an Object[] array where each element is another Object[] array of record values.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • nextRecord

        public java.lang.Object[] nextRecord()
                              throws DBFException
        Reads the returns the next row in the DBF stream. @returns The next row as an Object array. Types of the elements these arrays follow the convention mentioned in the class description.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord(java.lang.Object[] values)
               throws DBFException
        Add a record to the dbf. Note that this method actually writes the record to a temporary ArrayList and that the file will not be updated until the write() method is called.
        Parameters:
        values - an Object array containing the record values for each field.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • changeRecord

        public void changeRecord(int index,
                         java.lang.Object[] values)
                  throws DBFException
        Replace an existing record. Note that this method actually writes the record to a temporary buffer and that the file will not be updated until the write() method is called.
        Parameters:
        values - an Object array containing the record values for each field.
        Throws:
        DBFException

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(int recordNumber,
                         java.lang.Object[] rowData)
                  throws DBFException
        Throws:
        DBFException

        Removes the record of index recordNumber from the record data.
        Parameters:
        recordNumber. - Index of record to remove
        Throws:
        DBFException
